intro: Portulaca anacampseros, commonly known as the moss rose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces vibrant, showy flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, which bloom throughout the summer. Its fleshy, succulent leaves are adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils. The plant is often cultivated as a ornamental garden plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
